fewshot_cot.question: This rebus puzzle is an Idiom which may contain text, figures, and other logical clues to represent the Idiom. Can you figure out what this Idiom is?
fewshot_cot.rationale: The rebus contains the word bucket written in bold uppercase and there is a red droplet in the letter 'U', resembling a drop of liquid. Putting these clues together gives “A drop in the bucket.”

fewshot_cot.question: This rebus puzzle is an Idiom which may contain text, figures, and other logical clues to represent the Idiom. Can you figure out what this Idiom is?
fewshot_cot.rationale: The word “Edition” appears three times stacked, with the top one underlined—meaning 'first edition.'

fewshot_cot.question: This rebus puzzle is an Idiom which may contain text, figures, and other logical clues to represent the Idiom. Can you figure out what this Idiom is?
fewshot_cot.rationale: The phrase “kick the” is shaped like a V (the bottom of a bucket), together forming “kick the bucket.”

fewshot_cot.question: This rebus puzzle is an Idiom which may contain text, figures, and other logical clues to represent the Idiom. Can you figure out what this Idiom is?
fewshot_cot.rationale: “FEELING” is faded in the background under “WEATHER” in bold—i.e. feeling under the weather.

fewshot_cot.question: This rebus puzzle is an Idiom which may contain text, figures, and other logical clues to represent the Idiom. Can you figure out what this Idiom is?
fewshot_cot.rationale: The word “CUT” surrounded by dots at each corner and a red line cutting through—meaning “cut corners.”
